title: mind
comment: The seat of human consciousness, thought and desires. Scripture stresses that the minds of believers must be shaped by the knowledge and love of God, as their ways of thinking and acting become more like the pattern set out in Jesus Christ.

children.title: mind, of God
children.comment: God's pattern of thought and attitude of heart is holy, righteous and good. It is expressed in his law and his word, and also in the outworking of his mercy, but it is, ultimately, beyond human understanding.

children.title: God's mind is expressed in his law and his word
The mind of God is holy, righteous and good
The mind of God is also expressed in his merciful acts
The constancy of the mind of God
God changes his mind
Drawing back from threatened actions

primaryrefs.comment: The idea of God ``relenting'' does not mean a capricious change of mind, but the considered decision on God's part not to proceed with a threatened course of action in response to repentance on the part of individuals or the people.

children.title: Grieving over past actions
The mind of God is, ultimately, beyond human understanding
Because of God's greatness
Because of human lowliness
mind, of Christ
children.comment: The mind of Christ reveals the essence of God's nature. Jesus Christ desires that his followers adopt his attitudes; this comes about through the work of the Holy Spirit.

children.title: The mind of Christ discloses the mind of God
In relation to righteousness, holiness and the law
In mercy
The mind of Christ is made known to believers by the Holy Spirit
The plans and purposes of Jesus Christ are made known to the first Christians by the Spirit
Knowledge of the mind of Christ leads to holiness
mind, the human
children.comment: On account of its inner orientation the fallen human mind is in conflict with the mind of God. It is nevertheless capable of knowing God, and of being changed and renewed by him.

children.title: The human mind is the seat of reason and decision-making
The fallen human mind
The human mind is fatally flawed by sin
Even the fallen mind can know something of God through creation
The fallen mind tends to confuse the Creator with his creation
Consequences of the human mind's sinfulness
Sinful attitudes lead to sinful words and actions
Sinfulness leads to death
Doubt and instability
God can change the attitudes of the sinful human mind
The mind can be convicted of sin
The mind can be changed
It is God who enlightens the mind
It is God who renews the human mind
The renewed mind of the believer
Renewal brings knowledge of God
Renewal brings peace
Renewal leads to obedience
The believer's mind needs growth and renewal
